FuncDef:
The domain-search-list command configures a DNS search domain name.
The undo domain-search-list command deletes the configuration.
By default, no DNS search domain name is configured for an address pool.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a search domain.
The value is a string of 1 to 32 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

ExtraInfo: When the first-time domain name resolution for a DHCP client fails, the search domain name needs to be added for another resolution. To allow the DHCP server to send search domain names to DHCP clients through Option 119, run the domain-search-list command to configure a search domain name.
